member.name: F:CG.Web.MegaApiClient.ApiResultCode.RequestFailedRetry

member.name: F:CG.Web.MegaApiClient.ApiResultCode.TooManyRequests
member.summary: API_ERATELIMIT (-4): You have exceeded your command weight per time quota. Please wait a few seconds, then try again (this should never happen in sane real-life applications).

member.name: F:CG.Web.MegaApiClient.ApiResultCode.RequestFailedPermanetly
member.summary: API_EFAILED (-5): The upload failed. Please restart it from scratch.

member.name: F:CG.Web.MegaApiClient.ApiResultCode.ToManyRequestsForThisResource

member.name: F:CG.Web.MegaApiClient.ApiResultCode.ResourceAccessOutOfRange
member.summary: API_ERANGE (-7): The upload file packet is out of range or not starting and ending on a chunk boundary.

member.summary: API_EEXPIRED (-8): The upload target URL you are trying to access has expired. Please request a fresh one.

member.name: P:CG.Web.MegaApiClient.Options.BufferSize
member.summary: Size of the buffer used when downloading files This value has an impact on the progression. A lower value means more progression reports but a possible higher CPU usage

member.name: P:CG.Web.MegaApiClient.Options.ChunksPackSize
member.summary: Upload is splitted in multiple fragments (useful for big uploads) The size of the fragments is defined by mega.nz and are the following: 0 / 128K / 384K / 768K / 1280K / 1920K / 2688K / 3584K / 4608K / ... (every 1024 KB) / EOF The upload method tries to upload multiple fragments at once. Fragments are merged until the total size reaches this value. The special value -1 merges all chunks in a single fragment and a single upload

member.name: T:BigInteger
member.summary: This is a BigInteger class. Holds integer that is more than 64-bit (long).
member.remarks: This class contains overloaded arithmetic operators(+, -, *, /, %), bitwise operators(&, |) and other operations that can be done with normal integer. It also contains implementation of various prime test. This class also contains methods dealing with cryptography such as generating prime number, generating a coprime number.

member.summary: Default constructor for BigInteger of value 0

member.param: String value in the format of [sign][magnitude]

member.remarks: Shifting by a negative number is an undefined behaviour (UB).

member.summary: Overloading of greater than operator, allows comparing 2 BigIntegers with > operator

member.summary: Overloading of greater than operator, allows comparing 2 BigIntegers with < operator

member.returns: The bigger value of this and bi

member.param: BigInteger to be compared with this
member.returns: The smaller value of this and bi

member.summary: Returns the absolute value

member.name: M:BigInteger.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representing the BigInteger in base 10

member.name: M:BigInteger.ToString(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a string representing the BigInteger in [sign][magnitude] format in the specified radix
member.example: If the value of BigInteger is -255 in base 10, then ToString(16) returns "-FF"
member.returns: string representation of the BigInteger in [sign][magnitude] format

member.name: M:BigInteger.ToHexString
member.summary: Returns a hex string showing the contains of the BigInteger
member.example: 1) If the value of BigInteger is 255 in base 10, then ToHexString() returns "FF" 2) If the value of BigInteger is -255 in base 10, thenToHexString() returns ".....FFFFFFFFFF01", which is the 2's complement representation of -255.

member.name: M:BigInteger.modPow(BigInteger,BigInteger)
member.summary: Modulo Exponentiation
member.returns: BigInteger result of raising this to the power of exp and then modulo n

member.name: M:BigInteger.BarrettReduction(BigInteger,BigInteger,BigInteger)
member.summary: Fast calculation of modular reduction using Barrett's reduction
member.remarks:
Requires x < b^(2k), where b is the base. In this case, base is 2^32 (uint).
Reference [4]

member.name: M:BigInteger.gcd(BigInteger)
member.summary: Returns gcd(this, bi)
member.returns: Greatest Common Divisor of this and bi

member.name: M:BigInteger.genRandomBits(System.Int32,System.Random)
member.summary: Populates "this" with the specified amount of random bits

member.name: M:BigInteger.bitCount
member.summary: Returns the position of the most significant bit in the BigInteger
member.example: 1) The result is 1, if the value of BigInteger is 0...0000 0000 2) The result is 1, if the value of BigInteger is 0...0000 0001 3) The result is 2, if the value of BigInteger is 0...0000 0010 4) The result is 2, if the value of BigInteger is 0...0000 0011 5) The result is 5, if the value of BigInteger is 0...0001 0011

member.name: M:BigInteger.FermatLittleTest(System.Int32)
member.summary: Probabilistic prime test based on Fermat's little theorem
member.remarks:
for any a < p (p does not divide a) if a^(p-1) mod p != 1 then p is not prime.
Otherwise, p is probably prime (pseudoprime to the chosen base).
This method is fast but fails for Carmichael numbers when the randomly chosen base is a factor of the number.
member.returns: True if this is a pseudoprime to randomly chosen bases

member.name: M:BigInteger.RabinMillerTest(System.Int32)
member.summary: Probabilistic prime test based on Rabin-Miller's
member.remarks:
for any p > 0 with p - 1 = 2^s * t
p is probably prime (strong pseudoprime) if for any a < p, 1) a^t mod p = 1 or 2) a^((2^j)*t) mod p = p-1 for some 0 <= j <= s-1
Otherwise, p is composite.
member.returns: True if this is a strong pseudoprime to randomly chosen bases

member.name: M:BigInteger.SolovayStrassenTest(System.Int32)
member.summary: Probabilistic prime test based on Solovay-Strassen (Euler Criterion)
member.remarks:
p is probably prime if for any a < p (a is not multiple of p), a^((p-1)/2) mod p = J(a, p)
where J is the Jacobi symbol.
Otherwise, p is composite.
member.returns: True if this is a Euler pseudoprime to randomly chosen bases

member.name: M:BigInteger.LucasStrongTest
member.summary: Implementation of the Lucas Strong Pseudo Prime test
member.remarks:
Let n be an odd number with gcd(n,D) = 1, and n - J(D, n) = 2^s * d with d odd and s >= 0.
If Ud mod n = 0 or V2^r*d mod n = 0 for some 0 <= r < s, then n is a strong Lucas pseudoprime with parameters (P, Q). We select P and Q based on Selfridge.
member.returns: True if number is a strong Lucus pseudo prime

member.name: M:BigInteger.isProbablePrime(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether a number is probably prime using the Rabin-Miller's test
member.remarks: Before applying the test, the number is tested for divisibility by primes < 2000
member.returns: True if this is probably prime

member.name: M:BigInteger.isProbablePrime
member.summary: Determines whether this BigInteger is probably prime using a combination of base 2 strong pseudoprime test and Lucas strong pseudoprime test
member.remarks:
The sequence of the primality test is as follows,
1) Trial divisions are carried out using prime numbers below 2000. if any of the primes divides this BigInteger, then it is not prime.
2) Perform base 2 strong pseudoprime test. If this BigInteger is a base 2 strong pseudoprime, proceed on to the next step.
3) Perform strong Lucas pseudoprime test.
For a detailed discussion of this primality test, see [6].
member.returns: True if this is probably prime

member.name: M:BigInteger.IntValue
member.summary: Returns the lowest 4 bytes of the BigInteger as an int

member.name: M:BigInteger.LongValue
member.summary: Returns the lowest 8 bytes of the BigInteger as a long

member.name: M:BigInteger.Jacobi(BigInteger,BigInteger)
member.summary: Computes the Jacobi Symbol for 2 BigInteger a and b
member.remarks: Algorithm adapted from [3] and [4] with some optimizations

member.name: M:BigInteger.genPseudoPrime(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Random)
member.summary: Generates a positive BigInteger that is probably prime

member.summary: Generates a random number with the specified number of bits such that gcd(number, this) = 1
member.remarks: The number of bits must be greater than 0 and less than 2209

member.summary: Sets the value of the specified bit to 1

member.param: The position of bit to be changed

member.name: M:BigInteger.unsetBit(System.UInt32)

member.name: M:BigInteger.sqrt
member.summary: Returns a value that is equivalent to the integer square root of this
member.remarks: The integer square root of "this" is defined as the largest integer n, such that (n * n) <= this. Square root of negative integer is an undefined behaviour (UB).

member.name: M:BigInteger.LucasSequence(BigInteger,BigInteger,BigInteger,BigInteger)
member.summary: Returns the k_th number in the Lucas Sequence reduced modulo n
member.remarks:
Uses index doubling to speed up the process. For example, to calculate V(k), we maintain two numbers in the sequence V(n) and V(n+1).
To obtain V(2n), we use the identity V(2n) = (V(n) * V(n)) - (2 * Q^n) To obtain V(2n+1), we first write it as V(2n+1) = V((n+1) + n) and use the identity V(m+n) = V(m) * V(n) - Q * V(m-n) Hence, V((n+1) + n) = V(n+1) * V(n) - Q^n * V((n+1) - n) = V(n+1) * V(n) - Q^n * V(1) = V(n+1) * V(n) - Q^n * P
We use k in its binary expansion and perform index doubling for each bit position. For each bit position that is set, we perform an index doubling followed by an index addition. This means that for V(n), we need to update it to V(2n+1). For V(n+1), we need to update it to V((2n+1)+1) = V(2*(n+1))
This function returns [0] = U(k) [1] = V(k) [2] = Q^n
Where U(0) = 0 % n, U(1) = 1 % n V(0) = 2 % n, V(1) = P % n

member.name: T:DamienG.Security.Cryptography.Crc32
member.summary: Implements a 32-bit CRC hash algorithm compatible with Zip etc.
member.remarks: Crc32 should only be used for backward compatibility with older file formats and algorithms. It is not secure enough for new applications. If you need to call multiple times for the same data either use the HashAlgorithm interface or remember that the result of one Compute call needs to be ~ (XOR) before being passed in as the seed for the next Compute call.
